reference.title: DISTINCT clause
reference.shortdesc: The DISTINCT clause removes duplicate result objects from the query's result set. If the DISTINCT clause is not used, the query returns all objects that meet the query conditions in a result set.

section.title: Compatibility
section.p: Compatible with Couchbase Server 2.2 and higher

section.title: Example
section.p: The following examples show a simple DISTINCT clause using the Couchbase beer-sample bucket and N1QL tutorial.
section.codeblock: SELECT DISTINCT * FROM tutorial WHERE fname = 'Ian'
